Quantifiers and QP - Numbers Now consider numbers. They cannot be modified by the degree words like the quantifiers can, though they occur in the same position. Note, however, that numbers can be modified by numbers and by next and last, as in the first twenty boys or the next one hundred years. Ordinal numbers and next and last can also modify nouns directly, as in the third girl and the last boy.

Do not enter either feature QP-initial or QP-final on any ordinal numbers which can occur on either side.
Further, larger cardinal numbers can be compounds which may be written as independent words, such as one hundred thirty three. In many languages, conjunctions are either required or allowed in the compounds. The position of the conjunction is usually on the same side of the number as the smallest numbers are. For example, in English number compounds the conjunction appears towards the end of the compound, either before the last number (the ones digit) or the last two numbers in the compound (the tens and ones digits), as in four thousand and three or six thousand one hundred and thirty three.
